name: 2-[6-(4-methylphenyl)quinolin-2(1H)-ylidene]-1H-indene-1,3(2H)-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1155

name: 2-[6-(4-methylphenyl)quinolin-2(1H)-ylidene]-1H-indene-1,3(2H)-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1155
Reason: The core structure to consider is quinoline, which has a melting point of around 76°C. The 2,1,3-indenedione group, with its conjugated ketones, will likely increase the melting point due to added rigidity and planarity which enhances π–π stacking interactions (+40). The 4-methylphenyl group is similar to a toluene moiety attached to the ring, which would normally increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions (+20). The overall molecular complexity and potential for intermolecular hydrogen bonding can further increase the melting point significantly (+106).
